page.title: 02Farming.
page.content: Most farms in the area are small and mixed.The land is almost completely pasture and because of heavy rainfall ,there is an abundance of grass for livestock.The majority of farmers keep a dairy herd but usually have other stock as well.The dairy cows are mostly Freisian but one farm near the village has a herd of Guernseys.The best milking cows are usually put to a Friesian bull in the hope of getting a heifer calf for the herd but the others are often crossed with a Hereford or Charolais to produce a good beef calf.These are then sold as store cattle.The sheep in the area are mainly Welsh Mountain and are often crossed with a Suffolk ram to produce larger lambs. A few pigs are reared and most farms have some poultry.
